events.message: Customer reported a car collision that occurred on April 8th, involving another vehicle at an intersection.
The claim was categorized under Auto Accident after reviewing the initial report and vehicle details provided.
A claims agent specializing in vehicle collision claims was assigned to assist the customer promptly.
Customer received official acknowledgment of the accident claim submission via email and phone contact.
Request sent to customer for submitting police report, photos of damages, and insurance policy details.
Customer uploaded all requested documents including the accident police report and images of the damaged vehicle.
Investigation team began reviewing the submitted documents, photos, and third-party statements regarding the collision.
Investigation concluded that the customer was not at fault and assessed the vehicle damage accordingly.
A settlement amount covering full repair costs was proposed and sent to the customer for approval.
Customer expressed satisfaction with the proposed settlement and thanked the agent for quick processing.
The claim was officially approved by the claims manager after receiving customer consent for settlement.
Payment for the agreed settlement amount was processed and transferred to the customer's bank account.
The auto accident claim was officially closed after payment confirmation and customer notification.
